Plugin for TinyMCE

Requirements

  1. TinyMCE 4.0 or higher installed.
  2. A valid iMathEQ license. Purchase a license or email to support@imatheq.com to request trial license

Request plugin

Email support@iMathEQ.com to request plugin.

Integration

  1. Add iMathEQ plugin to TinyMCE editor

    1. After unzip, copy tinymce-plugin/imatheq folder to TinyMCE's plugin folder in your server

    2. In the HTML file with TinyMCE editor, in the "init" function, add "imatheq" to plugin list and toolbar, set paste_data_images to "true" and add "img[imatheq-mml]" to extended_valid_elements list, like:

      plugins: [ '[other plugins] imatheq' ],
      toolbar: '[other toolbar buttons] | imatheq',
      paste_data_images: true,
      extended_valid_elements : "img[[other attributes]|imatheq-mml]",

  2. Configure iMathEQ plugin according to your needs, "【your TinyMCE folder】\plugins\imatheq\conf\configuration.js":

    1. _imatheq_conf_modal_window

      1. true (default) - show editor as DIV layer
      2. false - show as popup

    2. _imatheq_conf_default_modal_win (Only applicable when _imatheq_conf_modal_window = true and not mobile browser)

      1. "restored" (default) - by default launch iMathEQ editor as restored window
      2. "maximized" - by default launch iMathEQ editor as maximized window

    3. _imatheq_conf_new_tab (Only applicable when _imatheq_conf_modal_window = false and not mobile browser)

      1. false (default) - show editor as popup window
      2. false - show editor as a new browser tab

    4. _iamtheq_popup_atttributes - Set the properties of popup window

      1. menu bar: 1(default) - show menubar, 0 - hide menubar
      2. resizable - 1(default) - allow user to resize popup window, 0 - not allow user to resize popup window
      3. width - width of the popup window, default 800px
      4. height - height of the popup window, default 600px

    5. _imatheq_conf_image_format - Decide whether save iMathEQ equation image as base64 string or PNG image file

      1. base64 (default) - save iMathEQ equation image as base64 string
      2. png - save iMathEQ equation image as PNG image file

    6. _imatheq_conf_save_image_api - The URL of server API to save equation image (only applicable when _imatheq_conf_image_format="png")

    7. _imatheq_conf_image_url_type - Decide the type of equation image URL (only applicable when _imatheq_conf_image_format="png"): direct image URL or API call

      1. image_path (default) - the equation image in HTML page will look like, <img src="..../[equation ID].png">
      2. api - the equation image in HTML page will look like, <img src="..../getequationimage.asp?iMathEQ_qid=[equation ID]">

    8. _imatheq_conf_image_url - The URL of equation image or API (only applicable when _imatheq_conf_image_format="png")

      1. _imatheq_conf_image_url_type="image_path" - the path of equation image without filename
      2. _imatheq_conf_image_url_type="api - the path of API to fetch equation image

Test sample codes

  1. Copy "tinymce-plugin\tinymce.html", "tinymce-plugin\tinymce_inline.html", css and img folders to your web site

  2. Update all the javascript file paths to point to the files in your server, like

    <script src="[your TinyMCE folder]/tinymce.min.js/">

  3. Launch a browser and browse to one of the html page

  4. To launch iMathEQ Equation Editor

    1. Put cursor where you want to insert math equation. Click button to launch iMathEQ Math Equation Editor

    2. Or double-click an existing math equation to launch iMathEQ Math Equation Editor

    3. Or select an math equation then click button to launch iMathEQ Math Equation Editor
